quote: Judge a person by their questions, rather than their answers.
The real object of education is to have a man in the condition of continually asking questions.
You can tell whether a man is clever by his answers. You can tell whether a man is wise by his questions.
A psychiatrist is a fellow who asks you a lot of expensive questions your wife asks for nothing
In the last analysis it is our conception of death which decides our answers to all the questions life puts to us.
Questions provide the key to unlocking our unlimited potential.
When is a crisis reached? When questions arise that can't be answered.
You mustn't always believe what I say. Questions tempt you to tell lies, particularly when there is no answer.
Judge a person by their questions, rather than their answers.
The real object of education is to have a man in the condition of continually asking questions.
You can tell whether a man is clever by his answers. You can tell whether a man is wise by his questions.
A psychiatrist is a fellow who asks you a lot of expensive questions your wife asks for nothing
In the last analysis it is our conception of death which decides our answers to all the questions life puts to us.
Questions provide the key to unlocking our unlimited potential.
When is a crisis reached? When questions arise that can't be answered.
You mustn't always believe what I say. Questions tempt you to tell lies, particularly when there is no answer.
Academic questions are interlopers in a world where so few of the real ones have been answered.
Animals are such agreeable friends, they ask no questions, they pass no criticisms.
As soon as questions of will or decision or reason or choice of action arise, human science is at a loss.
Ask no questions, and you'll be told no lies.
Asking the right questions takes as much skill as giving the right answers.
But a lot of shows, they pose questions and they give you a puzzle where there's no solution.
By nature's kindly disposition most questions which it is beyond a man's power to answer do not occur to him at all.
Every clarification breeds new questions.
For true success ask yourself these four questions: Why? Why not? Why not me? Why not now?
I had a million questions to ask God: but when I met Him, they all fled my mind; and it didn't seem to matter.
I'm not sure that it's the responsibility of a writer to give answers, especially to questions that have no answers.
I've never liked the recognition, the questions, the publicity. I have often felt like running away and hiding.
In an examination those who do not wish to know ask questions of those who cannot tell.
In order for answers to become clear, the questions have to be clear.
It is one of the chief skills of the philosopher not to occupy himself with questions which do not concern him.
It's better to know some of the questions than all of the answers.
Live your questions now, and perhaps even without knowing it, you will live along some distant day into your answers.
Love is the answer. But while you're waiting for the answer, sex raises some pretty good questions.
Man will not live without answers to his questions.
My greatest strength as a consultant is to be ignorant and ask a few questions.
No one is dumb who is curious. The people who don't ask questions remain clueless throughout their lives.
Psychiatrist: A man who asks you a lot of expensive questions your wife asks you for nothing.
Questions are never indiscreet. Answers sometimes are.
Questions structure and, so, to some extent predetermine answers.
Reason can answer questions, but imagination has to ask them.
Shocking writing is like murder: the questions the jury must decide are the questions of motive and intent.
Successful people ask better questions, and as a result, they get better answers.
Take the attitude of a student, Never be to big to ask questions, Never know to much to learn something new.
Take the attitude of a student, never be too big to ask questions, never know too much to learn something new.
The function of genius is not to give new answers, but to pose new questions - which time and mediocrity can solve.
The grand perhaps! We look on helplessly, there the old misgivings, crooked questions are.
The great questions of the day will not be settled by means of speeches and majority decisions but by iron and blood.
The quality of a leader cannot be judged by the answers he gives, but by the questions he asks.
The scientist is not a person who gives the right answers, he is one who asks the right questions.
War puts its questions stupidly, peace mysteriously.
We should not only master questions, but also act upon them, and act definitely.
What is work and what is not work are questions that perplex the wisest of men.
When great questions end, little parties begin.
Who questions much, shall learn much, and retain much.
Why are we here? Where do we come from? Traditionally, these are questions for philosophy, but philosophy is dead.
You know that children are growing up when they start asking questions that have answers.
You should not ask questions without knowledge.
